pros: Nice and clean campus, great students, great coworkers.
cons: Sometimes, you will have to drive between campuses in the same day.

pros: Faculty really care about students and the atmosphere is one of collegiality.
cons: In some positions the pay could be better.

pros: Decent infrastructure for what it is
cons: This place is the worst! Micro management, unrealistic expectations, and bad management

job_title: Work Study Student in Sugar Land, TX
pros: WCJC is like a huge family and everyone is willing to help you get the job done in any way possible. The staff was amazing.
cons: One down side was it was a work study position so I didn’t get to spend much time there.

review_title: Not a Bad Place to Work
pros: Instructors collaborate. Head of dept. became more flexible. Students appreciate instructors. Pays well for an ESL instructor position.
cons: UH requires everyone to pay over $500 to park in Sugar Land parking lot. It can never be a full time position. Students in pathways program need more support.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Bay City, TX
pros: Flexibility, friendly staff, close to home,
cons: No raises, paid monthly, no room for growth

pros: People you work with are wonderful!
cons: Administration needs to focus on the student and not profits and money, but that is about it.

job_title: Instructor, Computer Science in Richmond, TX
pros: Friendly colleagues and relaxed education environment is welcoming to new employees and students. Workplace provides funding for professional development opportunities.
cons: The maintenance and janitorial staff are lax and slow to fix new and existing problems. The IT department is also lax and slow to fix submitted IT tickets, sometimes ignoring them .

review_title: Working as a biology lab assistant; a work-study job
job_title: Lab Assistant in Sugar Land, TX
pros: You get legitimate lab experience, which will help you out a lot especially if you're planning on doing any research in the future.
cons: Pay is not the best, but I suppose that's expected give that it's a work-study job

review_title: Great colleagues, good work life balance, but lots of favoritism/different standards for different people
pros: Great colleagues, good work life balance.
cons: Lack of advancement opportunities, raises of $500 per year forever, different standards for different people.

job_title: Transition Coordinator in Sugar Land, TX
pros: flexible, nice, good people, friends, very open
cons: there is no cons that i can think of

pros: Lots of of days off with pay
